summary.para: Defines constants that specify how font families are grouped together. Used by , for example.
Families are grouped by the typographic family name preferred by the font author. The family can contain as many faces as the font author wants. This corresponds to .

Families are grouped by the weight-stretch-style family name, where all faces that differ only by those three axes are grouped into the same family, but any other axes go into a distinct family. For example, the Sitka family with six different optical sizes yields six separate families (Sitka Caption, Display, Text, Subheading, Heading, Banner...). This corresponds to .
